site.name: Illinois MakerLab
site.description: The world's first business school 3D printing lab at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

hours.note: Lab hours vary by semester. Check the lab hours page for current schedule.

primaryServices.name: Making Things Course
primaryServices.description: Hands-on course exploring 3D printing, prototyping, and digital fabrication. Offered every Spring semester.

primaryServices.description: Week-long digital making camps for youth

primaryServices.name: Workshops
primaryServices.description: Regular workshops on 3D printing and digital making

primaryServices.name: Private Events
primaryServices.description: Custom events and team building activities

commonQuestions.question: What are the lab hours?
commonQuestions.answer: Lab hours vary by semester. Check /lab-hours.html for current schedule.

commonQuestions.question: How much does 3D printing cost?
commonQuestions.answer: Pricing varies by service and material. See our pricing page for details.

commonQuestions.question: What courses does MakerLab offer?
commonQuestions.answer: We offer Making Things (BADM 331), a hands-on course where students plan, design, make, and market a new product. Offered every Spring. Digital Making (BADM 357) was discontinued after Spring 2019.

commonQuestions.question: Do you offer summer camps?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes! We offer week-long summer camps for youth focused on digital making and 3D printing.

commonQuestions.question: Can I host a birthday party at MakerLab?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes! We offer 3D printing-themed birthday parties. Contact us for details.

commonQuestions.question: How do I contact MakerLab?
commonQuestions.answer: Email us at uimakerlab@illinois.edu or visit BIF Room 3030.

achievements: World's first business school 3D printing lab
291+ blog posts documenting the maker journey
Partnership with Makers for COVID-19 for PPE production
